name: Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt
biography: Daughter of industrialist Peter Cooper, Sarah Amelia Cooper married her brother’s friend, Abram Hewitt, who became a U. S. Congressman and Mayor of New York City. They had six children—two of whom, Sarah and Eleanor, founded the Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration. Sarah Amelia had a passion for collecting French decorative arts and garden design. She once noted that she could not paint a picture, but she could design one.
biography_75_words: Daughter of industrialist Peter Cooper, Sarah Amelia Cooper married her brother’s friend, future New York mayor and founder of the New York City subway system, Abram Hewitt. They had six children—two of whom, Sarah and Eleanor, founded the Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration. Sarah Amelia had a passion for collecting French decorative arts and garden design. She once noted that she could not paint a picture, but she could design one. This portrait of Sarah Amelia was painted in 1893 and later donated to the museum by her son, Erskine.
biography_50_characters: Mother of the museum’s founders, Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
